These types of texts are referred to as a genre (‘metaphrastic’ texts). Thus, confusingly, especially to a non-Byzantinist, in modern scholarship ‘metaphrastic’ connotes texts by Symeon Metaphrastes and also texts rewritten using the rhetorical principles of metaphrasis. Stylistically, the MT does actually have much in common with the work of Symeon and his team.
